dialogues.text: Hey man, what's up? You sneak in here too? I'm Ed. I work here but they don't have to know that, am I right?

responses.text: I'm actually a detective, I was brought in to learn what happened here.
Do you actually know anyone here?

dialogues.text: Oh siick man, you are in for a doozy! I mean, I assume so. Nobody gives me the light of day except for sometimes Amanda. So I guess I wouldn't know.

Know? That's a funny word. I know about the people here, like how two mayoral candidates here are running against each other. I know I like the fisherman more. But do I really know anyone here? Nah, not really.
...I don't want to talk to you right now.
Hey Amanda, bored already?

responses.text: These people are too crazy for me!
Maybe I just like talking to you!

dialogues.text: Yeah, I get that. You can hang out with me any time!
Wait, you do? I mean, I like talking to you too...

responses.text: Why don't we hang out, like, when we get out of here?

dialogues.text: You'd do that? Man, I thought I was out of your league! I love you! I mean... I'd love to!
Who are you? Do you have an appointment with the mayor?

responses.text: No I don't. I'm investigating what happened here.

dialogues.text: What happened here? I'm afraid this is just getting started. This is going to be a long night for me I'm afraid. The mayor will need a lot of help in the office tomorrow at this pace.
Hi Claire. Are you having fun tonight?

responses.text: Not really.
We could be having fun! Say, you catching the hots for anyone?

dialogues.text: That's a shame. These parties should be illegal. I'd bring it up to the mayor but he seems to like them.
CLAIRE!! ...Okay, I guess I've had my eye on that hotel worker. You think he'd be into me?
Oh hey! Um, what are you up to?

responses.text: Just makin' the rounds.
I'm sick of this party. Do you wanna go on a date when this thing is over?

dialogues.text: Oh, well, good luck!
Really? You... actually like.... me? Um, of course I do Ed! I'll be ready!
Do you need something?

responses.text: Not right now.
Something came up. I'm going to need that report on my desk by Wednesday.

dialogues.text: Okay. Let me know if you need me.
Oh, okay, I understand. I'll get right on it!
What are you doing here? No one has been around these parts in a while. This town sure has seen better days.

responses.text: I'm actually a detective. It seems like there's a mystery to solve here.
What do you mean by better days?

dialogues.text: The mystery of why we are ghosts? I guess it's because of the dead atmosphere in here!
Well, do you see a lot of happy interaction around here? I don't think so.
Amanda! It's so good to see you. At least someone here wants to talk to me.

responses.text: What's going on?
Are you okay?
It's not your fault your family was splitting apart. Mark and Eugene are talking again.

dialogues.text: Quit play-acting. You know exactly what happened. I really don't want to relive it all again.
Not really. This is so boring. I hate the energy around here. At least I have you!
They really apologized to each other? I am so grateful! I do miss us being together. Maybe this town really can put itself back together.
Eugene my beloved... Why do you have to keep fighting with my father? You don't have to be right all the time!

responses.text: Uhh, because he sucks?
If he can't let this go, then enither can I!

dialogues.text: That is so out of character for you. Knock it off!
Eugene! You can't keep doing this to me!
Dad, can you keep the peace for just a while? I wish we could be a happy family again...

responses.text: I uh, can't?
I'll never forgive your husband for what he's done to me!

dialogues.text: Dad! What happened to being able to do anything!
How could you say that? He's your son-in-law!
Well if it isn't the resident busybody. What do you want?

responses.text: I'm worried about Eugene. As his aunt, I have a right to know what is going on.
Your father was a good friend of mine. Don't I deserve some answers?

dialogues.text: Okay, fine. My husband hasn't been the same since he lost that election to my father. It hurt me to see my family so bitterly divided.
Okay, fine. My dad has not been the same since he fell out with Eugene. I guess he never expected his own son-in-law to run against him in such a public way. Is this my fault?
